Reviews.Title: “The dirtiest hotel I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: tsushima
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the staff that I spoke with were very friendly and I tried to get this fixed before I wrote this review BUT my room stayed gross. Day 1, as soon as I walked in the room there was a funky dirty gym bag smell (It took me three days to figure out it was one of the chairs) and I found dirty dishes in the cabinets. Not dishes with dust- flat out grease and old food stuff on the dishes and placed in the cabinets. The bathtub had caked on grime, the towels were not only greying but were torn in places. The only time my room was vacuumed was when I complained. The really annoying thing was that this hotel is suppose to be eco friendly but they kept changing out my towels even though I hung it up. This continued on the the duration of my stay (over three weeks). I strongly recommend a different hotel. Freeways connect you to downtown from all directions- extend your search and drive a bit further if you have to

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre experience”
Reviews.Author: soonerrph
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay. On the first morning, had no hot water at 6:30am (Friday morning). After contacting the front desk, had hot water by 8am. On second morning, had no water pressure and little hot water. Problem never resolved the entire morning. Breakfast is very good. Good selection. Very few personal items available in their in-house "convenience store" (I had forgotten my toothbrush). Had to go to convenience store next door for personal care items.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel...more like a motel.”
Reviews.Author: JuneBug2633
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting. Trash was left in the room from the visitors before us. I had to call down TWICE to get towels because there was only a hand towel in the bathroom. For the money spent, it was TERRIBLE. I will not be recommending this hotel to any of my family and friends. With family in Indianapolis we frequent the area and usually stay in a hotel somewhere local. I will find a new hotel to give my business to. On top of all of the general issues when I spoke to the manager concerning my issues she couldn't have been more rude. Residence Motel. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: kelsosf1
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with every aspect of this hotel. The staff were exceptional, everything was very clean, the pool was perfect, the breakfast was a very nice presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kayofcny
Reviews.Content: Granted, I stay here on business and I have stayed here a lot but I would consider this particular hotel and other Residence Inns for potential vacation stays. My room has always been very clean. The bed comfortable. The staff always friendly and accomodating. I appreciate the galley kitchen although I use it rarely. Compared to breakfast at other hotels, the Residence offers a wider selection of hot entrees plus your standard fare. One suggestion, try to hit breakfast early while the scrambled eggs are creamy and not dried out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Audrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while in Indianapolis to visit family. The room was very reasonable - $89 plus tax - for a Residence Inn. It was a standard Residence Inn updated perhaps in the past 3 years, and near to the new airport. Clean. Room was typical studio with sitting area and small kitchen. We were in a building separate from the main building which meant we had to walk across the parking lot to go to breakfast - would not have been good in serious winter weather. Breakfast was standard fare but seemed to go fast. We had some road/traffic noise that we could hear from our room. Overall, everyting was fine but nothing outstanding or exceptional during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to expectations for a Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trllvr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one disappointment after another, especially considering it is part of the Marriott chain of hotels. I am a seasoned business traveller, and have stayed in hotels all over the world. I usually look forward to staying in a Marriott chain hotel because of the reliability of quality. This particular hotel was a total diappointment. The hotel is situated at the intersection of a highway (I-70) and a major roadway. The Indianapolis airport is adjacent to the hotel and guests of the hotel can hear planes all night long, in addition to the traffic on the neighboring highway/ roadway. The surrounding neighborhood is not nice, to say the least, which lead to me (a female traveller), not feeling comfortable leaving the hotel after dark. Loud, "souped up" cars were going up and down the main road (Lyndhurst) all night long. To summarize the negative aspects I experienced during my 6-day stay at the hotel: no hot water for a shower on morning number 1 (which also happened to 3 other co-workers I was travelling with), a very noisy room on night one, after which I requested to be moved (after a series of miscommunications with the front desk staff, to include giving me a key to a new room in which another guest was already checked in), I was moved to a somewhat quieter room. In the new room, the dishwasher was broken, as was the latch door lock, the shower curtain, and the coffee maker (which overflowed during brewing). In addition, the hotel rooms are not laid out like typical Residence inn's, with two separate rooms. Rooms at this hotel are not divided, and the hotel actually consists of two separate buildings- separated by a parking lot, which further aggrevated safety concerns for me personnally. The hot food at breakfast was continuously running out and the property seemed, overall, to be older and not well maintained. This was a major disappointment for a Marriott stay. On a positive note: breakfast staff was very friendly, as was the evening "happy hour" staff, which served guests willingly and went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 3tonkies
Reviews.Content: After staying in a Residence Inn the night before in Syracuse NY, I found this location lacking. I travel with pets and have no issue with non-refundable pet fees in order to be able to stay in a nice, clean, room. This room was gross. The hallway outside smelled of dog pee. My dogs were all over the room sniffing at the carpet, and found something interesting, dried dog poop droplets, embedded in the carpet. They weren't large, but still....nasty Then I found dog poop behind the bedroom door. Socks under the bed, lipstick on the glasses, all in all an experience I don't want to relive. i notified the evening desk clerk about my dissatisfaction, she apologized. In retrospect, I wish I would've asked for another room, but having driven 12 hours I was a little brain dead and just wanted to go to sleep. I told her I didn't mind the dog fee, but expected a clean room. I also complained at check out, and she expressed concern, stating she would speak with the manager and to expect that my pet fee would be refunded. I appreciate that greatly, but would have been happier paying the $100 and getting a room that wasn't nasty. I called the manager this morning, and she was very responsive. She had already refunded my $100, and had spoken with the contractor they use to sanitize the room., so while my experience wasn't good, I will say that the manager's response was terrific. She appreciated the comments and said that they become a better hotel by guests letting them know when they fall short. That's the right answer! For that reason alone I will check the "recommend" box.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: cindy924
Reviews.Content: Check in went smoothly. We stayed at other Residence Inn's and nothing compared to this. The furniture was old, not comfortable. Room had a strange odor. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent. If you go for one night, it's ok, but longer than that, think twice.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SnowFlaKeY2010
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Indy for a Jamfest Cheerleading event and chose the Residence Inn Indy Airport due to the great photos and reviews. I was a little skeptical when I first arrived because the hotel is near a residental area. But when I got inside to check-in, I was very pleased to see how clean and neat the facility was; it looked just like the online photos! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet opened at 5:30am which was perfect for my schedule and was full of variety. The suite was very clean, inviting and comfortable! It was fully equipped for preparing stove-top meals. I went to the store to buy more papertowels, but before I could use them, they had already started the dishwasher and restocked my papertowels! I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be near the airport and save city hotel costs!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tcouncil
Reviews.Content: The room I had here was like a mini one bedroom with a kitchen, which was nice. The hotel is an airport hotel so it is in a boring place to begin with. The staff, however, was quite helpful during my stay. Printed me off directions to drive to Bloomington in the morning and slid them under my door in the evening. Next time I am in Indianapolis I will probably go stay downtown since I have never been, but if I do have a short stay over that requires me to be close to the airport I would choose here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel by former Indy airport and very close to new airport”
Reviews.Author: Cheapseater
Reviews.Content: Indoor Residence Inn with nice rooms, solid service, good airport location and good weekend value rate. The hotel is near major roadways in Indy which makes for easy access around town and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: BlueRTA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn Airport for business travel in July 08. I had no negative issues with the room, it was clean, comfortable and about what I expected from a Residence Inn. The location was convenient and I had no problems with my stay. There was a little bit of airport noise but nothing that disrupted my sleep. Overall I would recommend this for utility stays, such as business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, caring staff and pet friendly too!”
Reviews.Author: Continental_8
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel for me and my parents who were visiting from out of town with his Marriott points. They came for the Talbot Street Art Fair and had to bring their dog with them this trip. Usually I can smell the unpleasant odors pets leave in the "pet friendly hotels" but not this one! First class all the way! The decor was wonderful, staff very friendly, courteous and genuinely interested in our stay there. The continental breakfast was one of the best I have had in a long while....not your usual bagels, half warmed bacon, eggs and pancakes. Things were very clean inside and out! Staff cares and it shows!

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are not enough to justify a stay here”
Reviews.Author: karolinakev
Reviews.Content: The hotel sits right next to the highway so it is both convenient and noisy--our room overlooked the highway and we heard traffic all night long. The rooms are updated with newer bed linens but the technology is out of date with huge clunky "flat screen" TVs and clock radios that are nothing special. The gym is atrocious with hardly working outdated equipment packed into a too small room near the pool which is teeming with noisy little children. The gym had an out of order eliptical and treadmill. So peoploe had to wait to get a machine. The price of the hotel is not cheap--so choose wisely among better, more modern choices just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Johnro
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel at the last moment after a flight cancellation. Initially reserved a room at the Fairfield Inn right next door but there was a problem with the door to our room locking so they moved us to the Residence Inn. Check-in at the Residence Inn was great and we got the same rate that we had over at the Fairfield Inn. The agent at the Check-in Desk showed true empathy that we had a problem next door and told us if we had any problem over here whatsoever just to let her know and she would personally take care of it. She said that she would even give us a call once we got settled in to make sure that everything was ok. Everything was perfect and we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Site, Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service of this hotel sets it apart from other hotels and I stay at a large number of Marriott hotels as well as extended stay hotels. The property was very well maintained. I would make sure to stay there again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at this location represents the worst expereince I've ever had with a Residence Inn (if not all hotels). They had to give us a smoking room because they over booked. After they tryed to deodorize the room, there was the smell of strong chemicals. This smell gave both of us the worst headaches and lasted the duration of our stay. The facilites were sub-par at best and the staff (although they worked hard) didn't seem to care much for their jobs or their place of work. I can understand this, but their attituteds made a bad situation worse. I don't often complain - but my trust in the Residence Inn name has been brused.

Reviews.Title: “heinous handicapped room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel in May of 2005, and was confident in booking this hotel again. However, little did I know I was booking a night when there was a big football game in town and the hotel was absolutely packed. Upon check-in the girl at the front desk switched my rooms, saying there had been some last minute changes... When I got into my room I saw it was a handicapped room and a heinous one at that. Why should handicapped people be assigned to such ugly rooms? Not only did it have an unfinished look, but there were odd, uneven RUTS in the floor, something I've never really seen before...couldn't something like that cause problems for a wheelchair? I can't imagine what these wide ruts are caused by???? The bathroom was something like I've seen in third world countries- it was as if the whole room was one big shower, the floor slanting towards a giant drain in the center, and a pathetic dribbling showerhead that hits me in about the middle of my chest. About 3 AM I was awakened by furious pounding on the ceiling and sounds of water running, and this went on until about (exactly) 4:42 AM. I know because I was kept awake that entire time, even with a pillow over my head. WHAT were they doing up there? Maybe because there was a big football game there was a party going on involving lots of showering? The bottom line IMHO is that it should NOT have been that loud and clear in my room what my neighbors were up to, if only my SPRINT PCS phone connection was that crystal clear! The walls in this room are wayyyy too thin! Now's it's almost 6 AM and I'm wide awake- I suppose it's a benefit that I'll get an early start on my day. The moral of this story is, if you find yourself booked into a handicapped room at this hotel, go IMMEDIATELY to the front desk and say anything you have to to get a different room!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is where I stay when I must be in town for a few nights. I stay several times a year. The staff is very helpful and the hotel is being updated. It is always very clean and neat. I am looking forward to the new bedding they have planned to add this summer. They pretty much know me by name now.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn Indianapolis Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 5224 West Southern Avenue, Indianapolis, IN 46241
